Kural_Info.Tamil_Text: தேரான் தெளிவும் தெளிந்தான்கண் ஐயுறவும் தீரா இடும்பை தரும்.
Kural_Info.English_Meaning: To make choice of one who has not been examined, and to entertain doubts respecting one who has been chosen, will produce irremediable sorrow.

Layered_Composition.Foreground: A king sits on his throne, trapped and in despair. His throne is being crushed between two giant, monstrous vices.
Layered_Composition.Midground: The monster on the left, labeled 'Trusting the Untested' ('தேரான் தெளிவு'), is a smiling, two-faced creature offering the king a poisoned chalice. The monster on the right, labeled 'Doubting the Trusted' ('தெளிந்தான்கண் ஐயுறவு'), is a shadowy beast that is chaining the hands of a loyal, capable minister.
Layered_Composition.Background: The kingdom behind the throne is in ruins, engulfed in the thorny vines of unending sorrow ('தீரா இடும்பை') that grow from the two monsters.

Art_Direction.Subject_and_Action: The two great errors in judgment—trusting the untested and doubting the tested—are personified as twin monsters that bring inescapable sorrow to a ruler.
Art_Direction.Symbolic_Motifs: The two monsters are the personifications of the two errors. The throne being crushed between them represents the ruler's downfall. The thorny vines symbolize the resulting endless sorrow.
Art_Direction.Lighting_and_Color: A dark, oppressive atmosphere. Each monster has its own sickly, colored glow—one deceptively warm, the other cold and shadowy. The overall palette is dark and full of despair.

Technical_Cues.Camera: A dramatic, low-angle shot that makes the two monsters seem overwhelming and the king seem helpless.
Technical_Cues.Lighting: High-contrast, dramatic lighting that highlights the king's suffering.

Negative_Prompt: happy king, friendly monsters, prosperous kingdom, text artifacts, cartoonish.

Hyperparameters.seed: Explore variations for the design of the two monsters.
